byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Anne Barnard and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Maher Samaan from Paris, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

abstract: United States-supported Syria Democratic Forces give Islamic State 48 hours to leave Manbij, Syria; ultimatum is issued in response to reports that coalition airstrikes had killed dozens of civilians.

headline.print_headline: Syrian Group, U.S.-Backed, Gives ISIS Ultimatum
headline.main: Group Backed by U.S. Gives ISIS 48 Hours to Leave Syrian City

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: The ultimatum comes after reports that dozens of civilians were killed this week near the city of Manbij in airstrikes by the United States-led coalition....
lead_paragraph: The ultimatum comes after reports that dozens of civilians were killed this week near the city of Manbij in airstrikes by the United States-led coalition.
